trans-unit.source: [Apache Storm](https://storm.incubator.apache.org) is a distributed real time computation system that simplifies reliable processing of unbounded streams of data.
trans-unit.target: [Apache Storm](https://storm.incubator.apache.org) is a distributed real time computation system that simplifies reliable processing of unbounded streams of data.

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to use an Event Hubs Storm spout to receive events from Event Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to use an Event Hubs Storm spout to receive events from Event Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Using Apache Storm, you can split events across multiple processes hosted in different nodes.
trans-unit.target: Using Apache Storm, you can split events across multiple processes hosted in different nodes.

trans-unit.source: The Event Hubs integration with Storm simplifies event consumption by transparently checkpointing its progress using Storm's Zookeeper installation, managing persistent checkpoints and parallel receives from Event Hubs.
trans-unit.target: The Event Hubs integration with Storm simplifies event consumption by transparently checkpointing its progress using Storm's Zookeeper installation, managing persistent checkpoints and parallel receives from Event Hubs.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Event Hubs receive patterns, see the [Event Hubs Overview].
trans-unit.target: For more information about Event Hubs receive patterns, see the [Event Hubs Overview].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses an [HDInsight Storm] installation, which comes with the Event Hubs spout already available.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses an [HDInsight Storm] installation, which comes with the Event Hubs spout already available.

trans-unit.source: Follow the <linkText>HDInsight Storm - Get Started</linkText><title></title> procedure to create a new HDInsight cluster, and connect to it via Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Follow the <linkText>HDInsight Storm - Get Started</linkText><title></title> procedure to create a new HDInsight cluster, and connect to it via Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: Copy the %STORM_HOME%\examples\eventhubspout\eventhubs-storm-spout-0.9-jar-with-dependencies.jar file to your local development environment.
trans-unit.target: Copy the %STORM_HOME%\examples\eventhubspout\eventhubs-storm-spout-0.9-jar-with-dependencies.jar file to your local development environment.

trans-unit.source: This contains the events-storm-spout.
trans-unit.target: This contains the events-storm-spout.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to install the package into the local Maven store.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to install the package into the local Maven store.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to add it as a reference in the Storm project in a later step.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to add it as a reference in the Storm project in a later step.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, create a new Maven project (click File, then New, then Project).
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, create a new Maven project (click File, then New, then Project).

trans-unit.source: Select Use default Workspace location, then click Next
trans-unit.target: Select Use default Workspace location, then click Next

trans-unit.source: Select the maven-archetype-quickstart archetype, then click Next
trans-unit.target: Select the maven-archetype-quickstart archetype, then click Next

trans-unit.source: Insert a GroupId and ArtifactId, then click Finish
trans-unit.target: Insert a GroupId and ArtifactId, then click Finish

trans-unit.source: In pom.xml, add the following dependencies in the node.
trans-unit.target: In pom.xml, add the following dependencies in the node.

trans-unit.source: In the src folder, create a file called Config.properties and copy the following content, substituting the following values:
trans-unit.target: In the src folder, create a file called Config.properties and copy the following content, substituting the following values:

trans-unit.source: The value for eventhub.receiver.credits determines how many events are batched before releasing them to the Storm pipeline.
trans-unit.target: The value for eventhub.receiver.credits determines how many events are batched before releasing them to the Storm pipeline.

trans-unit.source: For the sake of simplicity, this example sets this value to 10.
trans-unit.target: For the sake of simplicity, this example sets this value to 10.

trans-unit.source: In production, it should usually be set to higher values; for example, 1024.
trans-unit.target: In production, it should usually be set to higher values; for example, 1024.

trans-unit.source: Create a new class called LoggerBolt with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Create a new class called LoggerBolt with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This Storm bolt logs the content of the received events.
trans-unit.target: This Storm bolt logs the content of the received events.

trans-unit.source: This can easily be extended to store tuples in a storage service.
trans-unit.target: This can easily be extended to store tuples in a storage service.

trans-unit.source: The [HDInsight sensor analysis tutorial] uses this same approach to store data into HBase.
trans-unit.target: The [HDInsight sensor analysis tutorial] uses this same approach to store data into HBase.

trans-unit.source: Create a class called LogTopology with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Create a class called LogTopology with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This class creates a new Event Hubs spout, using the properties in the configuration file to instatiate it.
trans-unit.target: This class creates a new Event Hubs spout, using the properties in the configuration file to instatiate it.

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that this example creates as many spouts tasks as the number of partitions in the Event Hub, in order to use the maximum parallelism allowed by that Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: It is important to note that this example creates as many spouts tasks as the number of partitions in the Event Hub, in order to use the maximum parallelism allowed by that Event Hub.
